request.description:
Method for adding users. Users can be assigned roles which provide granular access at a table, operation, and attirbute level.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'add_user'
  • role (required) - id of the role you wish to assign to the user. See add_role for more detail.
  • username (required) - username assigned to the user. It can not be altered after adding the user. It serves as the hash.
  • password (required) - clear text for password. HarperDB will encrypt the password upon reciept.

Method for adding users. Users can be assigned roles which provide granular access at a table, operation, and attirbute level.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'add_user'
  • role (required) - id of the role you wish to assign to the user. See add_role for more detail.
  • username (required) - username assigned to the user. It can not be altered after adding the user. It serves as the hash.
  • password (required) - clear text for password. HarperDB will encrypt the password upon reciept.

Method for adding users. Users can be assigned roles which provide granular access at a table, operation, and attirbute level.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'add_user'
  • role (required) - id of the role you wish to assign to the user. See add_role for more detail.
  • username (required) - username assigned to the user. It can not be altered after adding the user. It serves as the hash.
  • password (required) - clear text for password. HarperDB will encrypt the password upon reciept.

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

exec: tests["Write Single Record"] = responseBody.has("successfully wrote 1 records");

request.description:
Method for inserting records. Can be used for a single insert or multiple records. If a large amount of records are being updated, we recommend using the .CSV load method. See our article on importing data sets here: http://harperdbhelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002007573-1Gigabyte-Limit-to-Request-Bodies NOTE: Hash value of the inserted JSON record MUST be supplied on insert.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'insert'
  • schema (required) - schema where the table you are inserting records into lives
  • table (required) - table where you want to insert records
  • records (required) - array of one or more records for insert

  • schema (required) - schema where the table you are inserting records into lives

  • records (required) - array of one or more records for insert

request.description:
Method for inserting records. Can be used for a single insert or multiple records. If a large amount of records are being updated, we recommend using the .CSV load method. See our article on importing data sets here: http://harperdbhelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002007573-1Gigabyte-Limit-to-Request-Bodies NOTE: Hash value of the inserted JSON record MUST be supplied on insert.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'insert'
  • schema (required) - schema where the table you are inserting records into lives
  • table (required) - table where you want to insert records
  • records (required) - array of one or more records for insert

exec: tests["Write Single Record"] = responseBody.has("successfully wrote 1 records");

request.description:
Method for inserting records. Can be used for a single insert or multiple records. If a large amount of records are being updated, we recommend using the .CSV load method. See our article on importing data sets here: http://harperdbhelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002007573-1Gigabyte-Limit-to-Request-Bodies NOTE: Hash value of the inserted JSON record MUST be supplied on insert.
  • operation (required) - must always be 'insert'
  • schema (required) - schema where the table you are inserting records into lives
  • table (required) - table where you want to insert records
  • records (required) - array of one or more records for insert

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table

This method is used to create a schema. A Schema can be thought of as a container of tables that are independent from tables in other schemas. An example might be the Schema dev could have a table called dog. The Schema Prod could also have a table called dog.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_schema
  • schema (required) - name of the schema you are creating

This method is used to create a table under the specified schema.
  • operation (required) - must always be create_table
  • schema (required) - name of the schema where you want your table to live
  • table (required) - name of the table you are creating
  • hash_attribute (required) - hash for the table
